body:
To do inference only, you should write another python script that:
1- loads the weights (see lines 201-205 of speaker_id.py)
2- reads the list of files that you want to classify "wav_lst_te=ReadList(te_lst)"
3- performs validation (from line 258 to 312). You can remove all the part about labels/losses that are not needed anymore. You can find the speaker predicted in the variable "best_class".

it would probably be a good idea to make it available. I uploaded a script for you.
[inference.zip](https://github.com/mravanelli/SincNet/files/3027608/inference.zip)

Thank you! Could you do a pull request with that?

Mirco

On Sun, 31 Mar 2019 at 22:53, Aaron Nicolson <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> it would probably be a good idea to make it available. I uploaded a script
> for you.
> inference.zip
> <https://github.com/mravanelli/SincNet/files/3027608/inference.zip>
>
> â€”

> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AQGs1un4MUZUqySwJ3VDCURBAQnPkQUfks5vcXS0gaJpZM4cPGo3>
> .
>

getting this error while doing inference  @anicolson @mravanelli 

`LOADING MODEL.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "inference.py", line 278, in <module>
    lab_batch=lab_dict[wav_lst_te[i]] # label for batch?
KeyError: 'TRAIN/DR1/FCJF0/SI1027.WAV'
`

Hi Akash,
the current vesion expects filenames in lowercase (e.g., "train
/dr1/fcjf0/si1027.wav" rather than "TRAIN/DR1/FCJF0/SI1027.WAV"). You can
either change the file names or change the script.

Best,

Mirco

Hi mirco,
Thanks for the quick response !!
I figured this out as the npy file have labels in lowercase so i was getting this error.

Hi,
How can I get the probability score of the output in inference? as I need to check the confidence of the given speaker output.

Hi,
the vector "pout" in line 291 of the speaker_id.py script contains the
posterior probabilities.

Best,

Mirco

On Tue, 4 Jun 2019 at 02:36, Akash Singh <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Hi,
> How can I get the probability score of the output in inference? as I need
> to check the confidence of the given speaker output.
>
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/mravanelli/SincNet/issues/23?email_source=notifications&email_token=AEA2ZVW6GRF6WRPVDXLDCJ3PYYEQNA5CNFSM4HB4NI32YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGODW3SGQA#issuecomment-498541376>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AEA2ZVQX7TPO6LFTCY6ASG3PYYEQNANCNFSM4HB4NI3Q>
> .
>

Hi,
the pout vector is of size[442,8], so where exactly I can find the probability score in the pout vector. What exactly values does the pout vector hold and what is the probability of the predicted output?

Hi,
pout contains the probability output for each time step of the given input
utterance. Just average them on axis=0 to have the final scores at
utterance level for your 8 classes.

Hi,
Taking mean across  axis 0 gives negative output.
```
pout.mean(0)
gives output:
tensor([-10.1677, -24.0729, -28.3911, -19.6000, -20.3166, -16.6840, -22.0630,
        -21.6579], device='cuda:0')
```

This is normal, because the output are log probabilities (see line 241 of
dnn_models.py).

Hi, 
taking the exponent of logsoftmax output probability should give me the probability score. so in above example the predicted log probability was  -10.1677 and exp(-10.1677) = 3.83897950602335e-05 . how can I get probability in range  0 to 1? by taking exponent across all elements on axis 0 and then taking the average?

Hi,
 taking exponent across all elements on axis 0 and then taking the average of it works fine.
Thanks

Great!
